name: dunkirk
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the English spelling of Dunkerque, a port town in northeast France, from where thousands of British soldiers were evacuated (= moved to safety) during the Second World War: You can get a ferry from Dover to Dunkirk. The tunnels were the nerve centre of the operation to evacuate troops from Dunkirk in 1940.
More examplesFewer examplesWe biked along the coast of the North Sea to Dunkirk.His brother was killed in fighting near Dunkirk.French fishermen clogged up the port of Dunkirk and British lorry-drivers choked roads into London and Cardiff.
